job_title: Assistant Director of Undergraduate Admissions in Fairfield, CT
pros: Car allowance for driving own vehicle
cons: I have few good things to say about working here. The culture, lack of empathy and almost non existent HR dept was shocking. Leadership was sexist. I was disappointed with my employer during the COVID pandemic. Admissions was forced to report to work everyday (July 2020 on) and interact with colleagues and prospective students/parents in-person everyday. COVID spread like crazy through our building and several people got sick from reporting to work. It did not matter how many people got sick from COVID in our building, the policies did not change. Anytime someone was out with COVID they were shunned by the other people in the office because they got to “work from home.” It was a terrible work culture. SHU did not care at all about the well-being of the Undergraduate Admission employees. All SHU cares about is getting students to enroll and getting those tuition dollars $. I have never felt like I mattered less than I did while working for Sacred Heart.

pros: Best Courses for Computer Science

pros: The campus facilities are nice.
cons: Pay, pay, and pay. When Norwalk Community College is paying 50% more per class, you know Sacred Heart has a problem. Bottom line: it's simply not worth it to teach a class as an adjunct at Sacred Heart.

review_title: Do not treat staff well, boys club

cons: They do not care about retaining employees, they treat you very much so as at will; "if you do not like it leave", An all boys club runs the show, poor pay, rather purchase property and add students without regard to employees. You will regret working here

pros: Great tuition remission program for full-time employees.
cons: The pay is not the best compared to other organizations.

review_title: Adjuncts are underpaid and management knows it!
pros: State-of-the-art facilities on a beautiful campus.
cons: Adjunct pay is just awful and administration knows it. No support whatsoever from full-time faculty and department heads. The diminimus increase that they gave to adjuncts after taxes at the beginning of the semester is enough to buy a pair of Levi's, some socks and undershirts from Walmart during the store's Black Friday doorbuster specials. It's bewildering to me that the university trustees have yet to wake up and recognize they have created an Institutional problem to the detriment of its longer-term success as well as that of its students.

cons: The HR dept is not there to assist employees they just worry about the bottom line. Unprofessional dept managers. Every year you get a raise your medical insurance goes up so you bring home less each year.
